page.title: 17GAMEKEEPING AT BOCONNOC
page.content: The{gamekeeper}is responsible for rearing{pheasants}and maintaining their{cover.}Work goes on every day of the year checking on the welfare of the birds. In{February}the{hen birds}are rounded up and fed extra food before the{laying season}in{April.}Each hen will lay up to{40 eggs,}these eggs are hatched in{incubators}and the chicks kept indoors until they are 6 weeks old{(poults).}They are then put into release pens with the netting sides down. When they are used to being outside the sides are lifted and the birds are free to wander. In one pen there may be as many as{700 poults. Food and water is provided at the side of the pens even when the birds are free. There are{two shoots}each year, one is{syndicated.
